item.title: interNational Nanny Training Day 2022
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Here are your options for the 2022 interNational Nanny Training Day held around North Carolina. If you want to be reminded of interNational Nanny Training Day in your email rather than having to seek us out, and you haven’t already, sign up for the iNNTD Reminder Email List. You will only get emails about iNNTD […]
item.content:encoded:
Here are your options for the 2022 interNational Nanny Training Day held around North Carolina. If you want to be reminded of interNational Nanny Training Day in your email rather than having to seek us out, and you haven’t already, sign up for the iNNTD Reminder Email List. You will only get emails about iNNTD and not other content, which most years means a single email. Sign up here:

Chapel Hill / Triangle

10 April Jen’s Totally Unofficial Day of Professional Development Content | must RSVP to get address (if you don’t have Facebook, send an email)

Charlotte

SUMMER DATE Charlotte’s Best Nanny Agency | email for tickets emily@charlottesbestnanny.com

Online

10 APRIL Pre-recorded, On Demand content released on 10 April. | tickets available 9 April

item.title: 2021 interNational Nanny Training Day and SARS-2
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Because we are still battling CoViD-19 and some places are heading into additional lockdowns while there are also group gathering restrictions still in place, the official international stance on interNational Nanny Training Day is to hold an entirely virtual/online asynchronous training day this year (April 17th; this Saturday). In addition, there will be a group […]
item.content:encoded:
Because we are still battling CoViD-19 and some places are heading into additional lockdowns while there are also group gathering restrictions still in place, the official international stance on interNational Nanny Training Day is to hold an entirely virtual/online asynchronous training day this year (April 17th; this Saturday). In addition, there will be a group live-stream on 17th April 2021 if OnDemand (asynchronous) doesn’t work for you. The asynchronous recordings will be available until 2nd May 2021. Plus, registered attendees will have access to a private Facebook group with additional content.

Secure your ticket @ https://nannypalooza.regfox.com/international-nanny-training-day-inntd

Learn more details @ https://www.nannypalooza.com/nntd.html

item.title: National Nanny Recognition Week & interNational Nanny Training Day
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: We have recently updated the post on the current standing of the interNational Nanny Training Days of North Carolina. 2020 once again claimed as victims all training days except Chapel Hill, which has gone virtual and is still on schedule for September 12th. Want a free admission? Help NannyCast with producing their annual Cards Against […]
item.content:encoded:
We have recently updated the post on the current standing of the interNational Nanny Training Days of North Carolina. 2020 once again claimed as victims all training days except Chapel Hill, which has gone virtual and is still on schedule for September 12th.

Want a free admission?

Help NannyCast with producing their annual Cards Against Humanity nanny-themed add-on pack by submitting card ideas and you’ll be entered into a raffle for FREE ADMISSION to interNational Nanny Training Day 2020: Chapel Hill.

Free.

Don’t believe us? Hear it from the source:

Get it done by September 9, 2020, and you might win.

Here’s how to submit your card ideas: https://forms.gle/TFmcrbi2ZQjhKGkDA

So what does this have to do with National Nanny Recognition Week? Well, if you’ll look at our schedule of events on the NC PAN National Nanny Recognition Week page, you’ll see that every Saturday of NNRW, NannyCast provides the nanny-themed add-on pack to everyone for free as a NNRW treat. So you’ll be helping yourself learn and helping yourself play!

You’ll notice that our calendar looks a little bit different this year. That’s because we’ve had to swap in-person events for remote events. Hopefully those remote events will still prove enjoyable enough that we’ll all have fun attending!

item.title: interNational Nanny Training Day and SARS-2
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: In light of the measures put in place to “flatten the curve” to prevent an overload of high risk patients in hospitals, several of the North Carolina interNational Nanny Training Days have canceled or postponed. This post will keep a running tally of which days have done what, by alphabetical order of city. As always, […]
item.content:encoded:
In light of the measures put in place to “flatten the curve” to prevent an overload of high risk patients in hospitals, several of the North Carolina interNational Nanny Training Days have canceled or postponed. This post will keep a running tally of which days have done what, by alphabetical order of city. As always, the North Carolina Nanny Calendar will be kept as accurate as possible.

Please keep in mind that venues and registration sites are not being as flexible with the current health emergency as we would like them to be, so if you are in the position to financially enable these event hosts to survive in order to provide quality training, please let them know that you are able to forego a refund or willing to accept a partial refund to compensate for deposit losses. No one is running interNational Nanny Training Day to make a profit. For your generosity, North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies is awarding registered attendees of these events a gratis (that means free) year of membership! Your event host will be able to provide you details of how to take advantage of that, if they haven’t already.

Chapel Hill

  • Postponed until September 12, 2020. Date confirmed.
  • Ticket holders individually contacted by Nanny Posse, LLC who is organizing the event. {source}
  • Online webinars provided to add educational content until date of rescheduled training day. {source}
  • Digital/virtual. Anyone can attend from anywhere. Invite friends from all over!

Charlotte

Canceled.

Greensboro

Canceled.

Raleigh

  • Postponed until July 2020. Specific date not yet provided. {source}
  • Ticket holders issued a refund + free admission to the July event. {source}
  • Additional items will be added to conference attendee giveaways to compensate for the delay. {source}
  • Canceled.

item.title: Why Employers Pay for (inter)National Nanny Training Day
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Having trouble coming up with the right words to ask your employers to pay for your ticket to (inter)National Nanny Training Day? National event organizer Nannypalooza has provided a solution in the form of this digital flyer. Share this flyer with your employers and they will see the value that a nanny who is able to attend professional development will […]
item.content:encoded:
Having trouble coming up with the right words to ask your employers to pay for your ticket to (inter)National Nanny Training Day?

National event organizer Nannypalooza has provided a solution in the form of this digital flyer. Share this flyer with your employers and they will see the value that a nanny who is able to attend professional development will bring to their household.

item.title: Let Us Ask Your Employer for You
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Sometimes it can be daunting to ask your employer to sponsor your admission to interNational Nanny Training Day. It is a lot easier when the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies makes the suggestion. We understand. We are nannies, too. We are more than happy to send an email to your employers informing them of […]
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes it can be daunting to ask your employer to sponsor your admission to interNational Nanny Training Day. It is a lot easier when the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies makes the suggestion. We understand. We are nannies, too.

We are more than happy to send an email to your employers informing them of interNational Nanny Training Day and making a case for why they should pay to send you. All we ask in return is that you provide us with a way to reach your employer(s).

We will use this information ONLY to reach out to them about this year’s interNational Nanny Training Day, and only reach out to them once. We will not save, sell, or otherwise misuse this information. It is important and, as nannies ourselves, we take our own employer’s contact information very seriously, so we will extend the same courtesy to yours. (Plus, we have a great track record of meaning what we say about this — just look at our National Nanny Recognition Week postcards!)

Help us help you!

Rather do it yourself?

Use this handy flyer as an icebreaker for a great conversation! Then point your employer(s) to the national listing of interNational Nanny Training Days to complete the ticket purchase process.

item.title: National Nanny Training Day: 2018
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: For Immediate Release. North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies has become known as the organization who hosts National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park. This began in 2014 when Lora Brawley, the original administrator of National Nanny Training Day, asked us to take on this important event in the absence of a willing host. This […]
item.content:encoded:
For Immediate Release.

North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies has become known as the organization who hosts National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park. This began in 2014 when Lora Brawley, the original administrator of National Nanny Training Day, asked us to take on this important event in the absence of a willing host. This privilege continued under the authority of current NNTD advisor, Sue Downey.

We offered the Research Triangle Park edition of National Nanny Training Day for the past three years, both with excitement and as the area lacked a ready and eager alternative.

For 2018, we are pleased that a local agency has requested to host National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park. We could not be more thrilled! They have our full support and well wishes for producing a great event for the nannies of the Triangle area.

This frees up a considerable amount of NC PAN volunteer resources to provide quality professional development across the whole of North Carolina throughout 2018 and beyond. This better fits our mission as a nanny professional development organization. We look forward to seeing you at a workshop training near you in the coming year!

In addition, the North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies is pleased to offer our support to any and all National Nanny Training Day events throughout North Carolina. We are available to contribute door prizes, membership information, and our three years of organizer expertise. Please do get in touch!

We hope to see you at your area’s National Nanny Training Day in April!

item.title: Our Programs Have Arrived
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: We are excited to see triangle-based nannies for tomorrow’s National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park! Below, you can find the digital copy of our program. A souvenir paper copy will be provided in your attendee bags during check-in.
item.content:encoded: We are excited to see triangle-based nannies for tomorrow’s National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park! Below, you can find the digital copy of our program. A souvenir paper copy will be provided in your attendee bags during check-in.

item.title: Are you making one of these mistakes?
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: 1. This is the month, and you still don’t have your ticket to National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park! You are going to miss out! Meeting other nannies over our networking lunch sponsored by My Girl Friday, is a great way to build up your professional network. You can rely on your professional network for coverage […]
item.content:encoded:
1. This is the month, and you still don’t have your ticket to National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park!

You are going to miss out!

Meeting other nannies over our networking lunch sponsored by My Girl Friday, is a great way to build up your professional network. You can rely on your professional network for coverage on days when you are sick or traveling. Plus, playdates with fellow nannies are always great!

 

2. Put the needs of others before your own.

This is exhausting! Compassion fatigue is tiring and once you are in its clutches, it isn’t easy to break out. Luckily, we have just the woman for the job!

 

3. Live paycheck to paycheck.

Not only does that add stress to your life, but can add tension to the employer-employee relationship. Attending our session on Financial Fitness can free you from that stress.

 

4. Pay out of pocket for professional development.

We get it! The added expense of National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park means you’d have to miss out. But did you know that nannies rarely pay their own way? EMPLOYERS PAY! Here’s how you get your bosses to send you.

 

5. Don’t stand up for themselves.

A common theme on nanny support groups is the nanny who says, “Yeah, I know I shouldn’t let them walk all over me, but …”

If this resonates with you, know that you aren’t alone. The first step to developing assertiveness is here!

 

Free yourself from these mistakes! Start, by attending National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park with us later this month.

item.title: Stand Up for Yourself with Emily Haas
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Normally when we think about self-defense, we think about Hollywood style stunt sequences. In reality, self-defense focuses on much more practical, mental and physical components. In this session, Emily Haas will discuss awareness and personal safety, as well as provide instruction in basic self-defense techniques. The best way to learn is to do! This is an interactive […]
item.content:encoded:
Normally when we think about self-defense, we think about Hollywood style stunt sequences.  In reality, self-defense focuses on much more practical, mental and physical components.  In this session, Emily Haas will discuss awareness and personal safety, as well as provide instruction in basic self-defense techniques.  The best way to learn is to do!  This is an interactive class where you will get to try techniques you learn.  Come prepared to participate.  (You do not need special clothing for this seminar).

Emily Haas is a Kukkiwon certified second degree black belt at White Tiger Taekwondo and Martial Arts in Cary, NC.  In addition to training, she competes in taekwondo competitions locally, nationally, and internationally, and is a state champion and two time national medalist.  She also co-coaches White Tiger’s Cadet Poomsae Team, is a certified wellness consultant (AFPA), and cross trains in parkour.  When she’s not focusing on taekwondo, Coach Emily spends time at her day job as a patent attorney.

Emily Haas will be the National Nanny Training Day: Research Triangle Park 2017 assertiveness speaker. But you’ll only see her if you have a ticket. Do you?

Join us! Ticket packages start at just $35 (meals included). Or perhaps you need to learn more, first?
